solution_line_template: First find the distance Matt climbs in {minutes} minutes: {matt_speed} feet/minute * {minutes} minutes = <<{matt_speed}*{minutes}={matt_distance}>>{matt_distance} feet
Then find the distance Jason climbs in {minutes} minutes: {jason_speed} feet/minute * {minutes} minutes = <<{jason_speed}*{minutes}={jason_distance}>>{jason_distance} feet

Then subtract the distance Matt climbs from the distance Jason climbs to find the difference: {jason_distance} feet - {matt_distance} feet = <<{jason_distance}-{matt_distance}={difference}>>{difference} feet
